metadata.original_utterance: All artifacts and deliverables are clearly listed with expected formats

scenario.title: Q2 Product Launch Planning Meeting
scenario.context: This meeting was scheduled to finalize the preparation plan for the upcoming Q2 product launch of the company's new mobile application. The team needed to align on deliverables, formats, and deadlines to ensure a smooth launch and compliance with internal quality standards.
discussion_points: Reviewed the full list of artifacts required for the launch package, including roadmap, marketing plan, UX design, and QA test strategy.
Confirmed expected formats for each deliverable (e.g., PDF for roadmap, Excel for marketing content, Figma for UX designs, Word for QA strategy).
Discussed the importance of having a centralized reference list of deliverables to avoid confusion and ensure compliance with internal documentation standards.
Agreed that Sarah will consolidate all deliverables into a single checklist and share it with the team.
action_items_discussed: Sarah to create and distribute a master deliverables checklist with expected file formats by Friday.
David to finalize the Marketing_Content_Plan.xlsx by March 20.
Priya to confirm engineering readiness report format and deadline.
James to upload the final UX_Design_Specifications.fig to the shared drive by March 18.
Linda to review and approve QA_Test_Strategy.docx by March 22.
known_constraints: Launch date is fixed for April 15; no flexibility on timeline.
Marketing campaigns require final content at least two weeks before launch.
Any delay in QA documentation could impact compliance sign-off.
stated_assumptions: All team members have access to the shared drive.
No major scope changes will occur after March 20.
Engineering dependencies are already resolved and will not delay documentation.

workback_plan:
# Workback Plan: Q2 Product Launch Preparation

## Goal
Ensure all required deliverables for the Q2 product launch are finalized, in correct formats, and consolidated before the fixed launch date of April 15, 2025.

## Timeline Overview
| T-n  | Date       | Task                                                     | Owner                               | Deliverable                               | Status  |
|------|------------|----------------------------------------------------------|-------------------------------------|-------------------------------------------|---------|
| T-24 | 2025-03-14 | Create and distribute master deliverables checklist      | Sarah Kim (Project Manager)         | Master Deliverables Checklist (PDF)       | Planned |
| T-22 | 2025-03-18 | Upload final UX design specifications to shared drive    | James Carter (UX Designer)          | UX_Design_Specifications.fig              | Planned |
| T-20 | 2025-03-20 | Finalize Marketing Content Plan                          | David Lopez (Marketing Lead)        | Marketing_Content_Plan.xlsx               | Planned |
| T-20 | 2025-03-20 | Confirm engineering readiness report format and deadline | Priya Singh (Engineering Manager)   | Engineering Readiness Report (Format TBD) | Planned |
| T-18 | 2025-03-22 | Review and approve QA Test Strategy                      | Linda Chen (Quality Assurance Lead) | QA_Test_Strategy.docx                     | Planned |
| T-0  | 2025-04-15 | Q2 Product Launch                                        | All                                 | Full Launch Package                       | Pending |

## Deliverables & Expected Formats
- **Q2_Product_Launch_Roadmap_v3.pdf** – PDF
- **Marketing_Content_Plan.xlsx** – Excel
- **UX_Design_Specifications.fig** – Figma
- **QA_Test_Strategy.docx** – Word Document
- **Master Deliverables Checklist** – PDF (to be created by Sarah)

## Known Constraints
- Launch date is fixed for April 15; no flexibility.
- Marketing campaigns require final content at least two weeks before launch.
- Any delay in QA documentation could impact compliance sign-off.

## Assumptions
- All team members have access to the shared drive. *(If invalidated: delays in uploading and reviewing deliverables)*
- No major scope changes will occur after March 20. *(If invalidated: rework and timeline risk)*
- Engineering dependencies are already resolved and will not delay documentation. *(If invalidated: readiness report and QA may slip)*

## Potential Blockers & Mitigations
- **Blocker:** Delay in Marketing Content Plan completion.
  - **Mitigation:** Schedule interim review on March 17.
  - **Owner:** David Lopez

- **Blocker:** QA approval delayed beyond March 22.
  - **Mitigation:** Linda to pre-review draft by March 18.
  - **Owner:** Linda Chen

## Open Questions
- Does the Engineering Readiness Report need to be included in the master checklist? (Pending Priya's confirmation)

assertions.text: All [DELIVERABLE] and [ARTIFACT] items are clearly listed with their expected formats.
assertions.original_text: All artifacts and deliverables are clearly listed with expected formats

rationale.mapping_reason: The assertion focuses on ensuring that all deliverables and artifacts are explicitly listed along with their expected formats, which directly aligns with the requirement to document deliverables and artifacts in the workback plan.

assertion_results.evidence: WBP Deliverables & Expected Formats section lists: Q2_Product_Launch_Roadmap_v3.pdf (PDF), Marketing_Content_Plan.xlsx (Excel), UX_Design_Specifications.fig (Figma), QA_Test_Strategy.docx (Word Document), Master Deliverables Checklist (PDF). However, the Engineering Readiness Report mentioned in the timeline is not included in this list with an expected format.
assertion_results.ground_truth_check: Scenario discussion points and action items include Priya confirming engineering readiness report format and deadline, implying it is a required deliverable.
assertion_results.reasoning: The assertion requires all deliverables and artifacts to be clearly listed with expected formats. The WBP omits the Engineering Readiness Report from the Deliverables & Expected Formats section, so it fails S4.

assertion_results.evidence: WBP references 'Engineering Readiness Report (Format TBD)' in the timeline, which is not listed in the scenario's artifacts array.
assertion_results.ground_truth_check: Scenario artifacts: Q2_Product_Launch_Roadmap_v3.pdf, Marketing_Content_Plan.xlsx, UX_Design_Specifications.fig, QA_Test_Strategy.docx. No Engineering Readiness Report is mentioned as an artifact.
assertion_results.reasoning: G4 requires all referenced files to correspond to real or creatable items from the scenario. The Engineering Readiness Report is not in the scenario's artifact list, so this is an extra entity not grounded in the scenario, causing a failure.

assertions.text: The listed artifacts and deliverables must correspond to real or creatable items, not fictional ones.
assertions.original_text: All artifacts and deliverables are clearly listed with expected formats

rationale.mapping_reason: The assertion requires that all artifacts and deliverables are clearly listed with their expected formats, which implies verifying that these deliverables actually exist or can be created from available artifacts.
